miscellaneous.name: Altar of Sacrifice
miscellaneous.description: Heroes can sacrifice creatures from their army in this structure to gain experience. The amount of experience gained is based on the hit points of the sacrificed creatures

miscellaneous.name: Black Market
miscellaneous.description: The market allows heroes to buy and sell artifacts

miscellaneous.name: Boat
miscellaneous.description: Boats are used by heroes on the adventure map to travel across water. They can be built at shipyards or summoned with the summon boat spell

miscellaneous.name: Border Gate
miscellaneous.description: This structure's purpose is to block access to parts of the map. It will only let heroes pass after they visit the Keymaster's tent of the same color

miscellaneous.name: Border Guard
miscellaneous.description: This structure's purpose is to block access to parts of the map. It will only let heroes pass after they visit the Keymaster's tent of the same color

miscellaneous.name: Cartographer
miscellaneous.description: The cartographer proposes to reveal the entire surface on the map for 1000 gold. It is very rare

miscellaneous.name: Cover of Darkness
miscellaneous.description: Visiting the Cover of Darkness will cover the nearest city with a permanent shroud for all players

miscellaneous.name: Den of Thieves
miscellaneous.description: Visiting the structure, the player learns information about the enemy heroes

miscellaneous.name: Dungeon Cartographer
miscellaneous.description: The cartographer proposes to reveal the entire dungeon on the map for 1000 gold

miscellaneous.name: Eye of the Magi
miscellaneous.description: Eye will reveal the area around after visiting the Hut of the Magi

miscellaneous.name: Freelancer's Guild
miscellaneous.description: Structure allows heroes to sell creatures for resources

miscellaneous.name: Garrison
miscellaneous.description: It is a gate that blocks passage to anyone except the player and their allies, and the enemy must defeat the garrisoned creatures to pass. They are often garrisoned by neutral creatures

miscellaneous.name: Hill Fort
miscellaneous.description: This structure can upgrade any creature in the visiting hero's army, usually at a reduced price

miscellaneous.name: Hut of the Magi
miscellaneous.description: Visiting it will reveal the area around the Eye of the Magi. The eye cannot be interacted with, and its only use is to provide sight through the Hut

miscellaneous.name: Jail
miscellaneous.description: The jail holds a hero that will join the side of anyone who frees them. Rescuing a prisoner from a jail is sometimes one of the objectives of a scenario

miscellaneous.name: Lighthouse
miscellaneous.description: When a hero gains control of the lighthouse, the faction's heroes gain a bonus to water movement

miscellaneous.name: Keymaster's Tent
miscellaneous.description: After a hero visits the tent, all of the player's heroes will be able to go through the border gates and border guards of the corresponding color

miscellaneous.name: Magellan's Maps
miscellaneous.description: Retired captain offers to reveal all of the water on the map for 1000 gold

miscellaneous.name: Monolith
miscellaneous.description: Going into a monolith will take the hero to another monolith. There are two kinds of monoliths: one-way and two-way

miscellaneous.name: Obelisk
miscellaneous.description: The obelisk reveals a piece of the puzzle map so the player can find the grail. They can appear in many different colors, but functionally they are all identical

miscellaneous.name: Ocean Bottle
miscellaneous.description: A bottle contains a message for the player

miscellaneous.name: Pillar of Fire
miscellaneous.description: This structure removes the fog of war in a big circle around itself when visited by a hero. They can only be found in dungeons

miscellaneous.name: Quest Guard
miscellaneous.description: This structure's purpose is to block access to parts of the map. It will give a quest to a visiting hero, and when the hero returns after completing the quest the quest guard disappears and allows passage

miscellaneous.name: Redwood Observatory
miscellaneous.description: This structure removes the fog of war in a big circle around itself when visited by a hero

miscellaneous.name: Sanctuary
miscellaneous.description: Entering the sanctuary, the hero will be protected from attacks by enemy heroes

miscellaneous.name: Seer's Hut
miscellaneous.description: This structure gives a quest to a visiting hero, and gives a reward when the hero returns after completing the quest

miscellaneous.name: Shipyard
miscellaneous.description: A visiting hero can purchase ships here. The cost is 1000 gold and 10 wood per ship

miscellaneous.name: Sign
miscellaneous.description: A sign indicates a direction or contains a message for player

miscellaneous.name: Sirens
miscellaneous.description: They can be found at sea, and if anyone visits them, they will kill 30% of that hero's army, but give them experience based on the hit points of the creatures

miscellaneous.name: Stables
miscellaneous.description: Increases the hero's movement day for the rest of that week, allowing them to move further on the adventure map

miscellaneous.name: Subterranean Gate
miscellaneous.description: Gate used to travel between the surface and the underground

miscellaneous.name: Tavern
miscellaneous.description: Taverns on the adventure map allow to recruit other heroes while away from their town

miscellaneous.name: Trading Post
miscellaneous.description: The trading post acts as a marketplace

miscellaneous.name: Whirlpool
miscellaneous.description: The whirlpool can be used to travel to another part of the map, but that will kill 50% of the creatures in the hero's lowest-tier stack
